required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pre- and Post-tests Impact of a Football Tournament on the Mental Well-being of Kuru Community Youths in Jos-South: A Single Arm Mixed Methods Study
clinical_study.official_title: Pre- and Post-tests Impact of a Football Tournament on the Mental Well-being of Kuru Community Youths in Jos-South: A Single Arm Mixed Methods Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Sporting activities such as football tournaments are instrumental in promoting community mental health. A community-based football tournament intervention will benefit the participating individuals' physical and mental health and promote community cohesion.
The anticipated benefits of the proposed football tournament are:
- To bring a greater sense of community cohesion and togetherness.
- To improve physical and mental health (e.g., increase fitness, reduce anxiety, depression, loneliness, suicidal ideation or self-harm).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Football Worry is being assessed
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at pre and post-intervention at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Primary outcome measure would be assessed using the Football Worry Scale

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Moral Disengagement in Sport is being assessed
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at pre and post-intervention at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Primary outcome measure would be assessed using the Moral Disengagement in Sport Scale

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Positive Mental Health is being assessed
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at pre and post-intervention at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Primary outcome measure would be assessed using the Positive Mental Health Scale

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Psychological Well-Being is being assessed
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at pre and post-intervention at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Primary outcome measure would be assessed using the Psychological Well-Being Measure

study_pop.textblock: Kuru community male youths in Jos-South local government area of Plateau State Nigeria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male youths
- Between 18 and 35 years
- Able to give informed consent
- Residents of the Kuru community of Jos-South
- No history of chronic health concerns (e.g., chronic heart disease, severe depression etc).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Females
- Below 18 or above 35 years
- Unable to give informed consent
- History of chronic health concerns (e.g., chronic heart disease, severe depression etc).
